intro: Actinocephalus incanus, commonly known as the hairy ant plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Actinocephalus incanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
